sx.blah.discord.handle.obj

Interface IReaction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Reaction

    public interface IReaction
    Represents a single emoji with the users that reacted.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IReaction copy()
      Creates a new instance of this object with all the current properties.
      IDiscordClient getClient()
      Gets the IDiscordClient instance this object belongs to.
      boolean getClientReacted()
      Returns true if this client's user reacted to the emoji.
      int getCount()
      The amount of people that reacted.
      IEmoji getCustomEmoji()
      The IEmoji object if this is a custom emoji reaction, or null otherwise
      IMessage getMessage()
      Gets the message for this reaction.
      IShard getShard()
      Get the IShard instance this object belongs to.
      boolean getUserReacted(IUser user)
      Returns true if the given user reacted to the emoji.
      List<IUser> getUsers()
      Gets the users that reacted.
      boolean isCustomEmoji()
      Whether or not this reaction is a custom emoji.
      String toString()
      Gets a string representation of the emoji.

    • Method Detail

      • getMessage

        Gets the message for this reaction.

        Whether or not this reaction is a custom emoji.
        Returns:
        If this is a custom emoji

      • getCustomEmoji

        IEmoji getCustomEmoji()
        The IEmoji object if this is a custom emoji reaction, or null otherwise
        Returns:

      • toString

        String toString()
        Gets a string representation of the emoji. Either the actual emoji, or the IEmoji#toString.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        The emoji, either as the emoji itself or the IEmoji formatted string

      • getUserReacted

        boolean getUserReacted(IUser user)
        Returns true if the given user reacted to the emoji. You may need to call refreshUsers first.
        Parameters:
        user - The user
        Returns:
        True if the user reacted, false otherwise

      • getClientReacted

        boolean getClientReacted()
        Returns true if this client's user reacted to the emoji. You may need to call refreshUsers first.
        Returns:
        True if we reacted, false otherwise
